record.id: field.name="predefinedFilterName" and file.name="SurveyDefinition" and term=NULL and format.name=NULL and syslanguage="en"
record.field.name: predefinedFilterName
record.file.name: SurveyDefinition

brief.brief: The name of the predefined filter. The predefined filter represents the view that is configured to be used in the survey records.

detail.detail: To create a predefined filter for a survey object, go to the inbox area. Create a new inbox for an object, and then enter the query you need. Inboxes are a common functionality in Service Manager.
However, specific characteristics have been implemented for survey module 2 :
1- To select an Inbox as a predefined filter in the survey module, the audience type has to be set to "Selected groups" and the value "Survey" has to be entered.

2- The inbox can store any query for the relevant object. To ensure that the survey solution can filter records by using data from the survey record, the placeholder "@fieldname@" has been introduced. This placeholder can be used within the query. This placeholder is replaced during run time with the value from the field in the survey.
